result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevis K. Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kevis K. Walker is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kevis K. Walker was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, On or Near a School], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Kevis K. Walker was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, On or Near a School], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Bond applied  -  Balance is still to be collected
If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Assessment of costs for Expert Laboratory Analysis and witness fees

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay fine of $500  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted shall be applied.    
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Take medications as prescribed.  
*  Pay prosecution costs totaling $330.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevis K. Walker

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney William Michel.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  
Count 1 - Defendant is sentenced to  5 years in the WSP forthwith with credit for 24 days; 2 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years of Extended Supervision.
Count 2 - Defendant is sentenced to  4 years in the WSP Consecutive to Count 1; 1 year Initial Confinement followed by 3 years of Extended Supervision.
DE is eligibile for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.   Prosecution Costs ordered in the amount of $330.00.  Court imposes a $500 fine plus costs & surcharge on both Counts 1 & 2.  Cash Bond on deposit is to be applied and any remaining balance owed is to be paid during supervision.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
Atty Wm Michel
